intro: Daphne verlotii, commonly known as the African daphne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with dense, evergreen foliage. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and they are clustered in umbels, giving it an ornamental appearance. Daphne verlotii is valued in horticulture for its attractive blooms and aromatic properties.
